They demonstrate a deep understanding of the Not-for-Profit industry and market trends. They can identify business challenges and opportunities to help clients navigate these challenges. They are able to offer business insights to internal and external parties relevant to the Not-for-Profit Industry.
9ab99d1d-e9d0-4b20-b92d-e0d50bd358c8.name: Not-For-Profit Industry - Experienced

22dd2b00-dec5-4d81-adeb-02d6fae8f87b.description: Product Managers are responsible for defining & supporting the building of desirable, feasible, viable, & sustainable products to meet customer needs in the product-market lifecycle. They own the product vision & roadmap. They manage cross-functional teams to deliver & partner with internal/external stakeholders. This provides skills to enhance an individual’s ability in the product manager role & hands-on experience in the Enterprise Transformation Stage Gate process (or an approved substitute)
22dd2b00-dec5-4d81-adeb-02d6fae8f87b.name: Product Management - Foundational

9791fc75-41e0-405d-839e-794a34197984.description: Earners of this badge have applied knowledge and experience to demonstrate the capabilities required to lead and facilitate teams executing the concept sprint model used at Grant Thornton to solve problems, validate ideas and de-risk investments in both the technical and non-technical settings. THIS IS A RESTRICTED AUDIENCE BADGE, APPROVAL IS REQUIRED. If you are interested in attaining this badge, please complete the survey below.

8b773330-d5a2-4d7a-957e-1f382ad0b6da.description: Earners of this badge will be exposed to Grant Thornton’s approach and methodology associated with Integration Advisory Assignments and Separation Assignments (Divestitures, Buy-side, Sell-side, Carve-out, etc.). badge_template_activities.title: In addition, a M&A Primer Course is included to introduce participants to the basic terminology associated with a transaction and Grant Thornton’s Enterprise Due Diligence approach (Quality of Earnings and Quality of Operations).

dd7fd69c-5eb9-4698-ace8-08efd2361ddc.description: The MLA experienced level badge is designed to support you in making the next step in your career journey. Complete a series of developmental experiences that demonstrates to others that one can successfully meet the expectations of an experienced manager.
